fullDescription.intro: This node concatenates two tables. The table at inport 0 is given as the first input table (top input port), the table at inport 1 is the second table, resp. Columns with equal names are concatenated (if the column type differs the column type is the common base type of both input column types). If one input table contains a column name that is not included in the other table, this column will also be included in the output table; it will contain missing values for those rows that are provided by the input table that does not have this column. The dialog enables dupplicate row keys to be treated: two options are available:
fullDescription.option: Duplicate row keys occuring in the second table are not appended to the output table.
The output table will contain all rows, but duplicate row keys are labeled with a suffix.

ports.dataIn: Table contributing the rows of the first part of the output table.
Table contributing the rows of the second part of the output table.
ports.dataOut: Table with rows from both tables.
